title: Panchakarma
shortDescription: A comprehensive detoxification and rejuvenation program that eliminates toxins and restores balance through five principal therapeutic procedures.
longDescription: Panchakarma is a cornerstone of Ayurvedic medicine, designed to remove toxins and restore balance within the body. This intensive cleansing regimen involves five principal procedures that eliminate excess doshas from the body.
lifestyleTips: Follow a light, sattvic diet during treatment

title: Abhyanga
shortDescription: Traditional Ayurvedic oil massage therapy that improves circulation, relieves muscle tension and promotes relaxation and wellbeing.
longDescription: Abhyanga is a form of Ayurvedic therapy that involves massage of the body with warm herbal oils. The massage is typically performed by two therapists working in synchrony, who use long, rhythmic strokes to stimulate the body's natural energy flow.
lifestyleTips: Take a warm bath after treatment
Avoid heavy meals before or immediately after
Drink plenty of warm water after treatment

title: Shirodhara
shortDescription: A soothing therapy where warm oil is poured over the forehead to calm the nervous system and enhance mental clarity.
longDescription: Shirodhara is a form of Ayurveda therapy that involves gently pouring warm herbal oil over the forehead, specifically the 'third eye' area. This continuous flow of warm oil on the forehead stimulates the pituitary gland, which helps regulate the entire endocrine system.
benefits: Deep relaxation of the nervous system
lifestyleTips: Avoid excessive mental activity after treatment
Keep the head warm and protected
Get extra rest the night of treatment
Avoid television and digital screens for a few hours after

title: Basti
shortDescription: A therapeutic enema treatment that cleanses and nourishes the colon to improve digestion, eliminate toxins, and balance Vata dosha.
longDescription: Basti is one of the most important Panchakarma treatments in Ayurveda, involving the administration of medicated oils or decoctions through the rectum. It directly addresses Vata imbalances, nourishing the colon and eliminating toxins from the large intestine.
lifestyleTips: Follow a light diet before and after treatment

title: Nasya
shortDescription: Nasal administration of herbal oils or powders to clear sinus passages, improve breathing, and enhance mental clarity.
longDescription: Nasya is a therapeutic treatment involving the administration of herbal oils, powders, or fresh herbal juices through the nasal passages. It treats disorders of the head, neck, and sensory organs by clearing accumulated toxins and improving oxygen flow to the brain.
lifestyleTips: Avoid cold foods and beverages after treatment
Keep the head and neck warm

title: Vamana
shortDescription: Therapeutic emesis procedure to remove excess Kapha dosha from the respiratory tract and treat conditions like asthma and congestion.
longDescription: Vamana is a controlled therapeutic emesis procedure designed to expel excess Kapha dosha from the upper part of the body. It's particularly beneficial for respiratory conditions, skin disorders, and chronic indigestion caused by Kapha imbalance.
lifestyleTips: Rest completely for 24 hours after treatment
Keep the chest and throat warm

title: Virechana
shortDescription: Therapeutic purgation treatment to remove excess Pitta dosha from the liver and intestines, purifying the blood and clearing toxins.
longDescription: Virechana is a controlled purgation therapy designed to eliminate excess Pitta dosha and toxins from the liver, gallbladder, and small intestines. It helps purify the blood and digestive tract, improving skin health and digestive function.

title: Udvartana
shortDescription: Invigorating herbal powder massage that exfoliates the skin, improves circulation, and helps in weight management by reducing Kapha.
longDescription: Udvartana is a vigorous massage therapy using herbal powders and pastes rubbed onto the skin in the opposite direction of hair growth. It helps reduce excess fat, improve circulation, and provide deep cleansing and exfoliation of the skin.
lifestyleTips: Drink warm water throughout the day

title: Kati Basti
shortDescription: Specialized treatment for lower back pain where warm medicated oil is pooled over the lumbar region to relieve pain and strengthen the spine.
longDescription: Kati Basti is a localized treatment where a dam made from dough is placed on the lower back, and warm medicated oil is pooled within this dam. The oil is retained for a specific time, allowing deep penetration to nourish the tissues and alleviate chronic back pain.

title: Janu Basti
shortDescription: Treatment for knee pain and stiffness where warm medicated oil is pooled around the knee joint to reduce inflammation and improve mobility.
longDescription: Janu Basti is a specialized treatment where a dam made from dough is built around the knee joint, and warm medicated oil is pooled within this dam. The oil deeply penetrates the joint, reducing inflammation and improving mobility for those suffering from knee pain and arthritis.

title: Netra Tarpana
shortDescription: Eye rejuvenation therapy where warm medicated ghee is retained around the eyes to improve vision and relieve eye strain.
longDescription: Netra Tarpana is an Ayurvedic eye treatment where a dam is created around the eyes, and warm medicated ghee is poured within this dam. The eyes are bathed in this nourishing ghee for a specific duration, helping to relieve dryness, strain, and improve overall eye health.
lifestyleTips: Take regular breaks from screen time
Consume foods rich in vitamin A

title: Pizhichil
shortDescription: Luxurious treatment where warm herbal oil is continuously poured and massaged over the body to reduce Vata disorders and rejuvenate tissues.
longDescription: Pizhichil, often called the 'royal treatment,' involves continuously pouring warm herbal oil over the body while simultaneously massaging it into the skin. This intensive therapy lasts 60-90 minutes and is excellent for nervous system disorders, arthritis, and deep tissue rejuvenation.

title: Njavarakizhi
shortDescription: Rejuvenating therapy where the body is massaged with boluses of cooked medicinal rice to strengthen muscles and reduce joint pain.
longDescription: Njavarakizhi is a unique treatment where special medicinal rice (Njavara) is cooked in milk and herbal decoctions, then placed in boluses of cloth. These warm boluses are used to massage the entire body, providing nourishment to muscles and relieving joint pain.

title: Swedana
shortDescription: Therapeutic sweating therapy using herbal steam to open channels, release toxins, and prepare the body for deeper detoxification treatments.
longDescription: Swedana is a therapeutic sweating procedure using herbal steam to induce sweating. Often performed after Abhyanga massage, it helps open channels in the body, dilate pores, and prepare the body for deeper Panchakarma treatments by loosening toxins and improving circulation.

title: Rasayana Therapy
shortDescription: Rejuvenation protocol using herbal formulations, diet, and lifestyle practices to enhance longevity, immunity, and overall vitality.
longDescription: Rasayana Therapy is a comprehensive protocol focused on rejuvenation and longevity. It involves special herbal preparations, dietary protocols, and lifestyle practices designed to promote cellular regeneration, enhance immunity, and prevent aging-related degeneration.

title: Lepam
shortDescription: Application of herbal pastes to the skin to treat various skin conditions, reduce inflammation, and enhance complexion and texture.
longDescription: Lepam involves the application of herbal pastes or poultices to the skin. Different herbal combinations are used based on the skin condition being treated. The paste is applied for a specific time and then removed, taking impurities with it and leaving the skin nourished and rejuvenated.

title: Herbal Steam
shortDescription: Localized or full-body steam treatment using medicinal herbs to improve circulation, clear respiratory passages, and relieve muscle tension.
longDescription: Herbal Steam therapy involves exposing the body to steam infused with medicinal herbs. It can be applied to the whole body or specific areas. The warm, herb-infused steam opens pores, improves circulation, helps clear respiratory passages, and relieves muscle tension.

title: Hair & Scalp Therapy
shortDescription: Specialized treatment using herbal oils and pastes to nourish the scalp, strengthen hair roots, prevent hair loss, and promote healthy growth.
longDescription: Hair and Scalp Therapy in Ayurveda involves specialized treatments using herbal oils, pastes, and rinses to address various hair concerns. Techniques include massage, hot oil treatments, and herbal applications that nourish the scalp, strengthen hair roots, and promote healthy hair growth.
